questions.question_text: Which of the following cloud models places all responsibility for operating system and application maintenance on the customer?

discussion.content:
From "Messer core 1 notes" 
Infrastructure as a service (IaaS)
• Sometimes called Hardware as a Service (HaaS)
• Outsource your equipment
• You’re still responsible for the management and security
• Your data is out there, but more within your control
• Web server providers

PaaS (someone else handles platform, you handle development) No servers, software, no maintenance team

Suraj97 my train of thinking here is that they are talking about a customer utilizing this device as in it is getting deployed in a box to a location the individual will set it up and maintain it themselves. A would be for SOHO purposes only or a singular user.

questions.question_text: A company subscribes to a vendor for office software that is delivered via the Internet rather than installed on each workstation. The company is using:

discussion.content: Shouldn't it be Software as a Service?? SaaS

Definitely SaaS. PaaS as I understood it is geared towards providing Platform where programmers can develop and test in.
An application, even provided through internet (think of office 365), is SaaS.

Selected Answer: B
Software as a Service

Selected Answer: B
B. SaaS (Software as a Service)

questions.question_text: A user is unable to access any LAN resources, such as network shares or printers, but is able to surf the Internet. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should a technician perform FIRST?

choices.D: Establish a theory of probable cause.

discussion.content:
It's D
unable to access any LAN resources ( Identify the problem)
He needs to create a theory

comments.content: I agree, He has to go through the process of "ok what could've happened to cause it to stop working", and then move onto seeing if there is any infrastructure changes

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
1. Identify the problem. • Question the user and identify user changes to computer and perform backups before making changes • Inquire regarding environmental or *infrastructure* changes • Review system and application logs

Selected Answer: D
You should make a theory. And I can say, which theory it may be: the notebook is connected with the guest WLAN.

Selected Answer: A
I would go with A.
1. Identify the problem.
•   Question the user and identify user changes to computer and perform backups before making changes
•   Inquire regarding environmental or *infrastructure* changes
•   Review system and application logs
I think you have to ask the appropriate questions before making a theory, I would go for A

choices.A: The system partition is set to active.
choices.C: The CD-ROM drive contains a Windows setup disk.
choices.B: A USB flash drive that contains offline diagnostics is plugged in.

questions.question_text: A user powers on a desktop computer, and the following error appears on the monitor: OS not found. The user notes there are no visual indications of an error. A reboot yields the same result. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

discussion.content: Boot into BIOS and make sure the hard drive the operating system is installed on is listed as the first boot device. If it's not, change the boot order so that it is.

comments.content: I agree with VLAN, it is Layer 2 and can be done easily
They can communicate with each other if the Default gateway ( router ) is connected to the switch.

discussion.content:
Vlan is layer2 switch's standardized function.
Assigning different vlans meaning cients and servers cannot communicate with each other even in the same NW. You can say they are in separate 2 groups.
* There is a way to make them communicate off course.

A.Separate DHCP scope dose not necessarily mean they are in different NWs or they are apart.
B. ACL's layer 3
C. I am not so sure of this one.
E. You cannot keep the server functioning in the same old way in a different domain.

comments.content: it's probably because the technician only have administrative permissions on the switch. so, by elimination "D", it's only possible answer

discussion.content: Can someone explain this, and i don't understand

choices.B: Implement an ACL on the switch.
choices.C: Place the web servers in a DMZ.
choices.E: Set up the web servers on a different domain.
choices.D: Configure the web servers in a separate VLAN.
choices.A: Create a separate DHCP scope for the web servers.

questions.question_text: A technician needs to secure and optimize traffic on a local network by separating client workstations from web servers. The technician only has administrative permissions on the Layer 2 switch to which all of the devices are connected. Which of the following should the technician complete to accomplish this goal?
